newsitem.title: FRANCE: Schiphol leads cargo traffic growth rates.
newsitem.headline: Schiphol leads cargo traffic growth rates.

text.p: Amsterdam's Schiphol airport recorded the highest percentage gain in cargo traffic last month among the EU's top cargo-handling airports, figures issued by the Paris airports authority, Aeroports de Paris (ADP) showed.
Schipol's cargo traffic in September 1996 totalled 87,200 tonnes, up 8.9 percent on the same month in 1995.
The three London airports (Heathrow, Gatwick and Stansted) handled 119,600 tonnes of cargo traffic last month, a rise of 5.5 percent on September 1995.
Frankfurt airport handled 114,500 tonnes in September, up 5.1 percent on the same month last year.
Last month's cargo volumet at the Paris airports (Charles de Gaulle and Orly) grew by four percent on September 1995 at 95,126 tonnes.
Of the EU's top four cargo-handling airports, Amsterdam also recorded the highest percentage gain in cargo traffic in the first nine months of 1996 with volume rising by 11 percent to 781,600 tonnes.
January-September 1996 cargo traffic handled at the London airports totalled 1,053,800 tonnes, up five percent on 1995 levels.
Frankfurt Jan-Sept cargo volume was 951,100 tonnes, up 2.5 percent on the same period last year.
Jan-Sept 1996 traffic at the Paris airports declined by 0.4 percent to 815,915 tonnes compared with last year. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
